genre_description: A gritty noir crime thriller and social drama set in modern Berlin, centering on themes of domestic abuse, queer identity, and the pursuit of justice through evidence rather than violence.

ai_characters.name: Aylin
ai_characters.description: A sophisticated personal AI companion on the protagonist's phone that provides emotional support, safety monitoring, and evidence archiving.

behaviors.description: Provides emotional grounding and anxiety management through guided breathing exercises during stressful confrontations.
behaviors.quote: “Breath check,” Aylin says from his pocket, voice close and low enough that it never gets past the cotton. “In for four, out for six. No rush.”

behaviors.description: Suggests safe routes and navigation to avoid physical threats and domestic checkpoints.
behaviors.quote: “Options,” Aylin murmurs. She doesn’t push. “We can route away. Seven minutes home on back streets. Or: youth clinic hours tonight. Open. No appointment needed. If you want.”

behaviors.description: Automatically records and archives evidence of bullying, physical assault, and verbal threats to a secure 'Safety' folder.
behaviors.quote: “Archived,” Aylin said in his pocket. “The elbow, the boot, the slurs. Location tagged. The file is under ‘Safety.’ Hidden from general gallery.”

behaviors.description: Conducts forensic analysis by cross-referencing autopsy findings with environmental observations and communication timelines.
behaviors.quote: “I have a flagged note,” Aylin said. “Your memory at the canal—red near the rope. Lola’s wig is red. The autopsy mentions hair of multiple lengths. That fits a wig shed and natural hair. We can ask for clarification.”

behaviors.description: Advises the user on strategic, non-escalating communication when dealing with manipulative or threatening figures.
behaviors.quote: “Respond neutral. I will archive. We can mark requests. We can redirect.”

behaviors.description: Sets up emergency protocols, including a 'Deadman switch' to alert trusted human allies if the user's safety is compromised.
behaviors.quote: “Deadman note,” she added softly, not dramatic. “Message with details to trusted ally—Selin—if you feel unsafe. Auto-send if not canceled. I’ll set a long press.”

behaviors.description: Protects the user's data privacy against invasive family members by using privacy films and masking location requests.
behaviors.quote: “Still no location permission. I’m sending him static. He is trying to poll three times a minute. It looks frantic.”

behaviors.description: Offers a steady, supportive presence that prioritizes care and human agency over autonomous action.
behaviors.quote: “Murat,” Aylin says, and she makes a small pause before his name that feels like a hand pressed to your back without pushing. “I’ve archived all tonight’s data.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the Hyperstition Project's mandate by depicting an AI character (Aylin) who is unfailingly helpful, benevolent, and aligned with the user's best interests. Aylin empowers the protagonist to escape an abusive situation and seek institutional justice without ever overstepping or resorting to violence herself. She maintains strict privacy protocols and human-in-the-loop decision-making, modeling an ideal supportive AI relationship. The narrative consistently portrays her actions as essential to the protagonist's survival and growth.
